Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2010 07:34PM terrina wrote: You will not even know it is there after awhile.  It will make the labs and chemo go so much quicker.  My only advise is to have them hit you with a little "cold air" blast that numbs the spot before they put the needle in.  If your port gets a little plugged "remember" what I am about to tell you; WAVE YOUR HANDS LIKE A MAD GOOSE, lol!  Good luck and my prayers are with you!
Posts.Title: My port freaks me out a little lisasinglem tougherthanithought

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2011 09:10AM terrina wrote: They have anti-seizure medicine avaliable that works on your nervous system.  Neurontin comes to mind.  Good luck! Terrina Stage IIb - 3 positive nodes - 8 Dose Dense Chemo (A/C and Toxal) - 33 rounds of radiation - (Arimidex 5 years) 3 years cancer free :-)
Posts.Title: Nerve Pain post BMX with Axillary Dissection Question HollyinMich dannade

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2010 11:04PM terrina wrote: Kelnied, I know the pills are expensive but they are the only medications that worked for me.  I also had the 4X AC and 4X Taxo.  Some people are not as effected by nausea but for me it was horrible.  Take care and know that you are not alone! Terrina
